title: HTML Tags: Advanced Concepts -1
description: Additional HTML tags with more specialized uses.

cards.q: What is the <meta> tag used for?
cards.a: The <meta> tag provides metadata such as document description, keywords, and character set.
The <link> tag links external resources like stylesheets to the HTML document.

cards.q: What is the purpose of the <script> tag?
cards.a: The <script> tag is used to embed or reference JavaScript code.
The <style> tag allows embedding CSS styles directly in the HTML document.
The <header> tag defines a header section for a document or section, typically containing headings and navigation.
The <footer> tag defines the footer section of a document or section, usually including author information or links.
The <section> tag defines a thematic grouping of content, like chapters or parts of a page.
The <article> tag represents self-contained content such as a blog post or news article.

cards.q: What is the role of the <nav> tag?
cards.a: The <nav> tag defines a section with navigation links.
The <audio> tag is used to embed sound content like music or speech.
